intro: Descurainia menziesii var. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular descurainia, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically oval and have a slightly hairy texture, with glands that secrete a sticky substance. This variety is often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky areas.
